| Precursor = | System = | Artery = | Vein = | Nerve = | Lymph = | MeshName =
Gap+Junctions | MeshNumber = | Code = | }} A 'gap junction' or 'nexus' is a
specialized intercellular connection between a multitude of animal cell-
types. It directly connects the cytoplasm of
two cells, which allows various molecules and ions to pass freely between
cells.

One gap junction channel is composed of two connexons (or hemichannels) which
connect across the intercellular space. Gap junctions are analogous to the plasmodesmata that join
plant cells.
